snippet: South Sudan, which the United Nations helped midwife into existence, has become one of the most dangerous theaters of operations for the world body.
abstract: Growing sense of frustration and distrust has begun to sour relationship between South Sudan government and United Nations peacekeeping mission there; country has become one of most dangerous theaters of operations for United Nations, which has had strong presence there since before South Sudan's recent independence.

byline.original: By JOSH KRON and NICHOLAS KULISH
byline.contributor: Josh Kron reported from Kampala, and Nicholas Kulish from Nairobi, Kenya.

lead_paragraph: South Sudan, which the United Nations helped midwife into existence, has become one of the most dangerous theaters of operations for the world body.

headline.main: For South Sudan and the U.N., a Relationship of Growing Distrust
headline.print_headline:
For Turbulent South Sudan and U.N.,
A Relationship of Growing Distrust

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
